resources.string: Your pantry is empty! (Ingredients you add from a search will be stored here.)
Enter an ingredient above (from a food package or any other source) to search for information on its relative toxicity.
The lethal median dose for %1$s is %2$d mg/kg. That means %1$s is about as toxic as %3$s.

\n\nRemember: Quantity matters! The point of this comparison is to demonstrate that toxicity is relativeâ€”not absolute. The hope is to offer a beginner-friendly overview of a basic toxicology concept by referencing familiar elements, but these results are not meant to be advice or guidance. True toxicity analysis is very complicated.
The lethal median dose for %1$s is %2$d mg/kg. That means %1$s is a bit more toxic than %3$s, but a bit less toxic than %4$s.

"Material is the metaphor.

"
"A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion." "The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet " "technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.
" "Surfaces and edges of the material provide visual cues that are grounded in reality. The " "use of familiar tactile attributes helps users quickly understand affordances. Yet the " "flexibility of the material creates new affordances that supersede those in the physical " "world, without breaking the rules of physics.
"
